src/lib/components/DashboardItem.react.j.description:
DashboardItem is a wrapper that is intended to be used with DraggableDashboard 
to specify the position and size of the wrapped components.

i.description: The ID used to identify this component in layout definition.

children.description: The child or list of children wrapped by the component.

x.description: The position on the x axis in number of columns (by default, the  max is 12).

y.description: The position on the y axis (the unit is 30px, by default)

w.description: The width of the x axis (default is 6).

h.description: The height on the of y axis (default is 4)

static.description: If true, equal to `isDraggable: false, isResizable: false`.

isDraggable.description: If false, will not be draggable. Overrides `static`.

isResizable.description: If false, will not be resizable. Overrides `static`.

setProps.description:
Dash-assigned callback that should be called to report property changes
to Dash, to make them available for callbacks.

src/lib/components/DashboardItemResponsi.description:
DashboardItemResponsive is a wrapper that is intended to be used with DraggableDashboard.
DashboardItemResponsive specify the position and size of the item on the dashboard.

id.description: The ID used to identify this component in Dash callbacks.

children.description: The child or list of children wrapped by the component.

x.description: The position on the x axis in number of columns (by default, the  max is 12).

y.description: The position on the y axis (the unit is 30px, by default)

w.description: The width of the x axis (default is 6).

h.description: The height on the of y axis (default is 4)

static.description: If true, equal to `isDraggable: false, isResizable: false`.

isDraggable.description: If false, will not be draggable. Overrides `static`.

isResizable.description: If false, will not be resizable. Overrides `static`.

__isDashboardItem.description:
This is an internal prop used to identify the component, this property default value is True. 
Setting this value to false is equivalent to not using the DashboardItem wrapper.

setProps.description:
Dash-assigned callback that should be called to report property changes
to Dash, to make them available for callbacks.

src/lib/components/DraggableDashboard.re.description:
DraggableDashboard is a component for building 
dashboards with draggable and resizable items.
It takes a list of children and display them in
div elements that can be moved around the page.
The initial size of each element can either be 
defined with the layout argument or by wrapping 
each element with the DashboardItem component.
By default, DraggableDashboard will saved the 
position of the elements on client side, when 
moved on the page. But you can also save it 
on server side by defining a callback with : 
`Input("<my-id>", "layout")`.

id.description:
(string) The ID used to identify this component in Dash callbacks.
The id is also used to automatically save the layout on client side.

layout.description:
Layout is a list of dictionnary with the format:
{x: number, y: number, w: number, h: number}
The index into the layout must match the id used on each item component with DashboardItem.
If you choose to use custom keys, you can specify that key in the layout
array objects like so:
{i: string, x: number, y: number, w: number, h: number}
The ID used to identify this component in Dash callbacks.
The id is also used to automatically save the layout on client side.

children.description:
Children is a list of the elements to drag and resize on the dashboard.
It can be a list of dash Components and/or DashboardItem.

save.description:
(bool) If False, then the layout is not saved in the browser.
Default value is True.

clearSavedLayout.description:
(bool) If set to true, then the layout saved in the client browser
will be cleared on page load.

ncols.description:
(number) the default number of columns by item.
Default value is 6.

nrows.description:
(number) the default number of row by item.
Default value is 8.

height.description:
(number) height of a row (in px).
Default value is 30.

className.description: (string) class passed to the react-grid-layout component

style.description: (dict) css style passed to the react-grid-layout component

setProps.description:
Dash-assigned callback that should be called to report property changes
to Dash, to make them available for callbacks.

src/lib/components/DraggableDashboardRes.description:
DraggableDashboard is a component for building
dashboards with draggable and resizable items.
It takes a list of children and display them in
div elements that can be moved around the page.
The initial size of each element can either be
defined with the layout argument or by wrapping
each element with the DashboardItem component.
By default, DraggableDashboard will saved the
position of the elements on client side, when
moved on the page. But you can also save it
on server side by defining a callback with :
`Input("<my-id>", "layout")`.

id.description:
(string) The ID used to identify this component in Dash callbacks.
The id is also used to automatically save the layout on client side.

layouts.description:
Layout is a list(python)/vector(R) of dictionnary(Python)/list(R) with the format:
{x: number, y: number, w: number, h: number}
The index into the layout must match the id used on each item component with DashboardItem.
If you choose to use custom keys, you can specify that key in the layout
array objects like so:
{i: string, x: number, y: number, w: number, h: number}
The ID used to identify this component in Dash callbacks.
The id is also used to automatically save the layout on client side.

breakpoints.description:
({breakpoint: number}) The breakpoints for the responsive layout.
For each screen size (breakpoint) we can define a different layout.
(see also 'layouts' and 'gridCols' arguments)
Default value is {lg: 1200, md: 996, sm: 768, xs: 480, xxs: 0}

gridCols.description:
({breakpoint: number}) the number of columns in the grid layout.
Default value is {lg: 12, md: 10, sm: 6, xs: 4, xxs: 2}.

children.description:
Children is a list of the items (dash Components and/or 
DashboardItem) to diplay on the layout.
By default all the items can be dragged and resized.

save.description:
(bool) If True, then the layout is automatically saved on client browser.
Default value is True

clearSavedLayout.description:
(bool) If set to true, then the layout saved in the client browser
will be cleared in the next page load.

ncols.description:
({breakpoint: number}) the default number of columns by item.
Default value is {lg: 6, md: 5, sm: 3, xs: 4, xxs: 2}.

nrows.description:
(number) the default number of row by item.
Default value is 8.

height.description:
(number) height of a row (in px).
Default value is 30.

className.description: (string) class passed to the react-grid-layout component

style.description: (dict) css style passed to the react-grid-layout component

setProps.description:
Dash-assigned callback that should be called to report property changes
to Dash, to make them available for callbacks.
